author: zkgpt
content: hi, I'd appreciate it if anybody could share a faucet where I can get some test ETHs on `EIP-4844 Devnet`, tried to use https://eip4844-faucet.vercel.app/ 1 hour ago but did not receive any tokens yet

author: tersec
content: Is `BlobsBundleV1` in https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/experimental/blob-extension.md#blobsbundlev1 meant to bea compatible with minimal-preset EIP-4844 as defined in https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/presets/minimal/eip4844.yaml where `FIELD_ELEMENTS_PER_BLOB: 4`, which leads to a `Blob` according to https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/eip4844/polynomial-commitments.md#custom-types having a length of `4 * 32`, not `4096 * 32`?

author: tersec
content: If it is, how? If it's not, is that documented somewhere, and what's the intended error fallback?

author: terence0083
content: I dont think the minimal preset will work as of today. How does 1.) CL signals EL or 2.) user input EL client to use minimal config?

author: tersec
content: so right now, EIP4844 is mainnet-preset only?

author: tersec
content: (my answers to those questions would be, by separately configuring each, the way networks are configured to be compatible in general)

author: terence0083
content: But I believe there's minimal spec test which tests `4 * 32` if you are interested

author: tersec
content: yes, the `consensus-spec-tests` repo includes tests based on `4 * 32`, and Nimbus passes those fine

author: tersec
content: it's hooking them up to the engine API which is causing issues

author: tersec
content: but, alright, for now will just treat this as mainnet-only

author: __flcl
content: As for the point evaluation precompile, we do not check length of data passed to it to be exactly 192 bytes, right?

author: henridf
content: We're using `c-kzg-4844/src/trusted_setup.txt` as our trusted setup, correct?

author: inphi
content: that's right. It's also in JSON at https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/presets/mainnet/trusted_setups/testing_trusted_setups.json

author: inphi
content: Spec only needs the input to be at least 192 bytes. But we probably should update it to check that it's exactly 192 bytes.
